alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Burlington, Mercer, and Monmouth. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Florence, Bristol, Bordentown, Tullytown, Allentown, Langhorne, Florence-Roebling, White Horse, Levittown, and Crosswicks. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 8. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 351 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 55 and 62. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
